subject: mathematics
explanation: Fractions don't have to be slow! Master these quick methods and solve fraction problems in half the time. Key tricks: 1) Cross multiply for comparisons, 2) Find common denominators using LCM shortcuts, 3) Convert to decimals when easier, 4) Use unit fractions (1/2, 1/3, 1/4) as building blocks, 5) Simplify before calculating. Remember: every fraction question has a fast route!

examples.question: Add 3/8 + 5/12 quickly
examples.explanation: LCM of 8 and 12: 8 = 2³, 12 = 2² × 3, so LCM = 24. Quick method: 3/8 = 9/24, 5/12 = 10/24, so 9/24 + 10/24 = 19/24. Always find LCM by prime factors!

examples.question: Compare 7/9 and 5/7 instantly
examples.explanation: Cross multiply: 7 × 7 = 49, 9 × 5 = 45. Since 49 > 45, we have 7/9 > 5/7. No need to find common denominators!

examples.question: Calculate 2/3 of 2/5 of 45
examples.explanation: Work left to right: 2/5 of 45 = 18 (since 45 ÷ 5 × 2 = 18). Then 2/3 of 18 = 12 (since 18 ÷ 3 × 2 = 12). Or all at once: 2/3 × 2/5 × 45 = 4/15 × 45 = 12

examples.question: Simplify 36/48 in one step
examples.explanation: Quick GCD method: Both end in 6 and 8, so divisible by 2. 36÷2=18, 48÷2=24. Both 18 and 24 divisible by 6: 18÷6=3, 24÷6=4. So 36/48 = 3/4
